texts.value: Converts monoacylglycerides to free fatty acids and glycerol (PubMed:19029917, PubMed:20079333, PubMed:21049984, PubMed:22969151, PubMed:24368842). Hydrolyzes the endocannabinoid 2-arachidonoylglycerol, and thereby contributes to the regulation of endocannabinoid signaling, nociperception and perception of pain (PubMed:19029917, PubMed:20079333, PubMed:21049984, PubMed:22969151, PubMed:24368842). Regulates the levels of fatty acids that serve as signaling molecules and promote cancer cell migration, invasion and tumor growth (PubMed:20079333)

reaction.name: Hydrolyzes glycerol monoesters of long-chain fatty acids.
a 1-acylglycerol + H2O = glycerol + a fatty acid + H(+)
a 2-acylglycerol + H2O = glycerol + a fatty acid + H(+)
prostaglandin E2 1-glyceryl ester + H2O = prostaglandin E2 + glycerol + H(+)
prostaglandin D2-1-glycerol ester + H2O = prostaglandin D2 + glycerol + H(+)
prostaglandin F2alpha 1-glyceryl ester + H2O = prostaglandin F2alpha + glycerol + H(+)

texts.value: Detected in adipose tissue, lung, liver, kidney, brain and heart

Short-term inhibition causes analgesia, while long-term inhibition causes tolerance to endocannabinoids acting on brain cannabinoid receptor CNR1, and a reduction in brain cannabinoid receptor CNR1 activity
Belongs to the AB hydrolase superfamily. Monoacylglycerol lipase family

features.description: Does not affect ability to hydrolyze 1- or 2-monoacylglycerol.
